sentence.Network_en: Already, both sides are jockeying to belittle the other side.
sentence.Network_cn: 双方已经在使出浑身解数贬低对方了。

sentence.Network_en: We mustn't belittle her outstanding achievement.
sentence.Network_cn: 我们一定不能小瞧了她所取得的杰出成就。

sentence.Network_en: It is wrong to belittle or neglect popularization.
sentence.Network_cn: 轻视和忽视普及工作的态度是错误的.

PerfectNetExp.abs: GRE 词汇表(红宝书) - 豆丁网 ... belie v． 掩饰，证明为假 belittle v． 轻视，贬抑 bellicose adj． 好战的，好斗的.
英语常见词根前缀后缀大全 ... befit 适宜 belittle 贬低 be- == 在.
英语词根词缀记忆大全 ... befall 降临；发生 belittle 小看 bewilder 使…迷惑.
GRE 词汇表(红宝书) - 豆丁网 ... belie v． 掩饰，证明为假 belittle v． 轻视，贬抑 bellicose adj． 好战的，好斗的.

list.abs: When you belittle others , you are actually the one who appears small ., 当你轻视他人时 , 真正渺小的其实是你自己.
Don ' t belittle your colleagues ., 不要轻视你的同事.
...tures of the current stage of development in China妄自菲薄 belittle oneself自甘落后 be resigned to backwardness
when they belittle us for demanding clean air and clean water for trying to save the oceans and the ozone layer , that's wrong .当他们轻视我们过分要求清洁的空气和清洁的水来设法拯救大洋和臭氧层，那是错的。

entry.def: If you belittle someone or something, you say or imply that they are unimportant or not very good.

example.ex: We mustn't belittle her outstanding achievement...
example.tran: 我们一定不能小瞧了她所取得的杰出成就。

example.ex: It makes no sense to belittle the enormity of the disaster.
example.tran: 没有理由低估这场灾难的严重性。

means.word_mean: 3. lessen the authority, dignity, or reputation of;

auth_sentence.content: People tend to belittle what they don't understand.
auth_sentence.res_content: People tend to belittle what they don't understand.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: People tend to belittle what they don't understand.

auth_sentence.content: I just think both sides tend to belittle the other.
auth_sentence.res_content: I just think both sides tend to belittle the other.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: I just think both sides tend to belittle the other.

auth_sentence.content: It's not to belittle sufferers of a particularly nasty illness.
auth_sentence.res_content: It's not to belittle sufferers of a particularly nasty illness.
auth_sentence.res_content_con: It's not to belittle sufferers of a particularly nasty illness.

sentences.en: a person who belittled our efforts to do the job right.
sentences.cn: 一个小看我们为做好工作而付出的努力的人

sentences.en: A poor but honest man is not to be belittled.
sentences.cn: 穷而诚实的人是不该让人小看的。

sentences.en: The size of the office tower belittles the surrounding buildings.
sentences.cn: 这座办公楼的规模使周围的建筑物相形见小。

sentences.en: It is wrong to belittle or neglect popularization.
sentences.cn: 轻视和忽视普及工作的态度是错误的。

sentences.en: I find it belittle to be reprimanded by someone so much younger than me.
sentences.cn: 我觉得,被这麽个比我年龄小得多的人训斥,真太失身分了。

sentences.en: Don't patronize or belittle the person that you have conflict with
sentences.cn: 不要轻视或者小看与你有争议的人
